title: Truffle Config File Not Being Read Properly
body:
- [ ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

I am feeding truffle a config file and want it to look for a network but it seems to not be able to read that there is a specified network configuration. Super weird. Never had this problem before. 

## Steps to Reproduce

```
module.exports = {
  // See <http://truffleframework.com/docs/advanced/configuration>
  // to customize your Truffle configuration!
  development: {
    host: '127.0.0.1',
    port: 23889,
    network_id: '*', // eslint-disable-line camelcase
    from: '0x7926223070547d2d15b2ef5e7383e541c338ffe9',
    gasPrice: '0x64', 
  },
};
```


## Expected Behavior

it to connect to the bridge I have set up at the localhost and port

## Actual Results

here's where things get interesting. Normally I'd chalk it up to a communication issue. But for some reason I cannot get it to move from the default port and net id numbers.

```
Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.

> Something went wrong while attempting to connect to the network. Check your network configuration.

Could not connect to your Ethereum client with the following parameters:
    - host       > 127.0.0.1
    - port       > 7545
    - network_id > 5777
Please check that your Ethereum client:
    - is running
    - is accepting RPC connections (i.e., "--rpc" option is used in geth)
    - is accessible over the network
    - is properly configured in your Truffle configuration file (truffle-config.js)

Truffle v5.1.29 (core: 5.1.29)
Node v8.11.3
```
Have tried on later node versions as well. Same problem. 

## Environment

* Operating System: OSX
* Ethereum client: Alternative client 
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.1.29
* node version (`node --version`): 8.11.3
* npm version (`npm --version`): 5.6.0
Weird - thanks for opening an issue! Can you see if this is something that was introduced in a recent version of Truffle, to help diagnose the problem?
hey @VoR0220 , can you show us what command you're running?
```truffle migrate --reset```

if I try to run it ```truffle migrate --network development --reset``` I get this. 

```
Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.

Unknown network "development". See your Truffle configuration file for available networks.
```
derp. Thanks.
Glad that was easy!
I had the same issue but mine is nested within a network. I cant seem to get it to work

Hi, I'm experiencing this issue as well. All the settings are correct. Error is happening after running truffle compile. I have attached the screenshot for more info. Any idea @CruzMolina ?
![config-file](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43106142/134790618-48833498-fbeb-4ffd-a0ea-a9f4066660fb.PNG)
![truffle-compile](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43106142/134790619-ebedc65b-9ec3-4031-b7c1-8f840f256195.PNG)

I have exact same issue.
Please help me, I am new in truffle and smart contract development.
Thanks in advance.
Same here

> I have exact same issue. Please help me, I am new in truffle and smart contract development. Thanks in advance.



> Same here

If you guys are using GUI. This is when it usually happens. I would recommend use via cmd by installing ganache-cli.
This should resolve this.

Cheers

Hi there,
I had the same issue :
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38952196/153487621-eeadfd80-6d11-48f6-ae7a-bd7dfafa7037.png)
So, the port 7545 was required but truffle-config.js asked for port 8545:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38952196/153488584-1cc5633b-8e96-4bd1-92be-a1930d64d2b8.png)
Then, I typed this (I have ganache installed, it was named ganache-cli before):

$ ganache -p 8545

same error again; then, without changing my truffle-config.js, I tried

$ ganache -p 7545

it worked for the port, but another problem appeared:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38952196/153498069-9e42834d-be3c-4936-a5bf-5c691a855b5f.png)
Then I tried :

$ ganache -p 7545 -i 5777

Cool ! It works:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38952196/153497794-97e06bab-3b51-4747-8f77-fbb9ce6e9432.png)

But I really don't know why because my truffle-config.js file specifies "port 8545". 
Maybe the answer is in truffle/webpack.config.js ? And what was that problem with the network ID ? Strange...

If you want to use that network configuration you need to pass in the `--network <networkName>` option. So in your case, if you would like to use the configuration under "development", you will need to enter `truffle migrate --network development`. If you don't specify a network, Truffle will use some internal defaults. I hope this helps!
@SebastienBosca, You are looking at the wrong way. You first run Ganache, then based on a port it's running. You pass to the truffle-config file.
@eggplantzzz Great, `$ truffle migrate --network develop `      works very well, thanks !

Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.
> Something went wrong while attempting to connect to the network at http://127.0.0.1:7545. Check your network configuration.

Could not connect to your Ethereum client with the following parameters:
    - host       > 127.0.0.1
    - port       > 7545
    - network_id > 5777
Please check that your Ethereum client:
    - is running
    - is accepting RPC connections (i.e., "--rpc" or "--http" option is used in geth)
    - is accessible over the network
    - is properly configured in your Truffle configuration file (truffle-config.js)

Truffle v5.5.13 (core: 5.5.13)
Node v16.15.0
同样的问题。新手 有哪位大神帮忙指导一下 谢谢
这是我的  truffle-config.js

Hi @kimpace19882627 感谢回复。请您新建一个issue来讨论。[新建issue](https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle/issues/new/choose)的时候会给您模版，请填入相关信息（`truffle-config.js`，报错信息，命令，等等）
看了您的`truffle-config.js`，没有标明`127.0.0.1:7545`的port。
如果方便的话请把分享报错的代码（请不要发密钥），这样重现+调查可以更有效，谢谢
